content:
As an AI language model, I don't have access to real-time information about restaurants or their ratings. However, I can suggest some ways to find good Ethiopian restaurants in your area:

- Check online review sites like Yelp or Google reviews to see which Ethiopian restaurants have the best ratings and reviews from customers.

- Ask friends, coworkers, and acquaintances who have tried Ethiopian food for their recommendations.

- Look up Ethiopian restaurants on social media platforms like Instagram, where you can find photos of the food and get a sense of the atmosphere.

- Check with Ethiopian cultural centers or associations in your area, as they may have information about authentic Ethiopian restaurants and events.

When you go to an Ethiopian restaurant, be sure to try injera, which is a sourdough flatbread made from teff flour. It is traditionally used to scoop up stews and vegetable dishes known as wots. Some other dishes you might want to try include doro wot (spicy chicken stew), kitfo (raw beef tartare), and shiro (ground chickpea stew). Enjoy your culinary exploration!
